intro: Hancea eucausta, commonly known as the Australian hakea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, often spiny foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Hancea eucausta is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant features. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
